mapper.sql: a.id AS "id", a.serial_no AS "serialNo", a.exam_class_name AS "examClassName", a.exam_subclass_name AS "examSubclassName", a.input_code AS "inputCode", a.craete_by AS "craeteBy", a.craete_date AS "craeteDate", a.update_by AS "updateBy.id", a.update_date AS "updateDate", a.remarks AS "remarks", a.del_flag AS "delFlag"
mapper.insert: INSERT INTO exam_subclass_dict( id, serial_no, exam_class_name, exam_subclass_name, input_code, craete_by, craete_date, update_by, update_date, remarks, del_flag ) VALUES ( #{id}, #{serialNo}, #{examClassName}, #{examSubclassName}, #{inputCode}, #{craeteBy}, #{craeteDate}, #{updateBy.id}, #{updateDate}, #{remarks}, #{delFlag} )
mapper.update: UPDATE exam_subclass_dict SET serial_no = #{serialNo}, exam_class_name = #{examClassName}, exam_subclass_name = #{examSubclassName}, input_code = #{inputCode}, craete_by = #{craeteBy}, craete_date = #{craeteDate}, update_by = #{updateBy.id}, update_date = #{updateDate}, remarks = #{remarks} WHERE id = #{id}
